AVSEC CIRCULAR NO. 19 /2009 
 
Subject: Contingency Plan for handling aircraft hijack situation. 
 
 
Para No. 1.7(a) of the  Contingency  Plan  for handling aircraft hijack 
situation (approved by CCS and circulated vide MCA Office Memo. No. AV. 
13024/2/2000-SS dated 13/9/05) provides  that all efforts  should  be made   to 
get the hijacked  Indian registered  aircraft  to land  at an Indian Airport, 
preferably  one of  those  already  identified  for this  purpose. Once such  an 
aircraft  lands  at an Indian airport,  it shall  be  immediately   immobilized and  
shall not be allowed to  go out of India. 
 
2. 
In view of above, the  following  instructions shall be strictly  implemented  
by all concerned :- 
 
(i) 
The Indian registered  hijacked aircraft  shall be  directed  by the 
concerned  ATC to land  at  one  of the  airports, which have  
already been identified  for  this  purpose, namely: Mumbai, 
Kolkata, Chennai, Thiruvananthapuram, Nagpur,  Hyderabad, 
Ahmedabad, Bangalore, Guwahati, Chandigarh, Jaipur and 
Lucknow; and   
 
(ii) 
On landing at one of the identified airports, such an aircraft  shall be 
immediately   immobilized   as per   instructions  issued  vide  
BCAS  AVSEC  Order  No. 9/2001 dated 16.11.2001  (copy 
enclosed).In order to avoid delay in this regard immediate 
necessary action to immobilize the aircraft shall be taken  by the  
Airport  Director of the affected  airport. 
 
3. 
This issues with the approval of Commissioner of Security (CA); and 
supersedes BCAS Circular No. 43/2005 dated 31.10.2005. 
 
Encl : As above. 
 
 
 
(M. Malaviya, IPS) 
Addl.  Commissioner of Security (CA)
